model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I have plan to make garden in my home. I want some suggestion from you.
Speaker B: Plum trees and pair trees would be my suggestion in the summer when they blossom they have such a lovely flower on them
Speaker A: IN MY HOME?! A TREE? That was not at all what I was thinking. Do they grow well indoors? I am intrigued. 
Speaker B: Well if you want to make it like a proper garden experience then I would suggest going all in, and go for the best most authentic looking items you could get 
Speaker A: Wow! Ok! This is sounding like a bigger undertaking! Should I embrace bugs in the home if they help the plants or am I getting wild?

MEMORY:
Speaker B is knowledgeable about plants and gardening, with a thriving garden. Speaker B mentions weight gain from spending time at the computer and plans to work in the garden more. Speaker A struggles with gardening but finds the idea of space plants intriguing.
